{{EngvarB|date=October 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2013}} The '''People's Liberation Guerrilla Army''' (PLGA) is the armed wing of the [[Communist Party of India (Maoist)]], a [[Communist Party of India (Maoist)#Legal status|banned]] organisation in [[India]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.hindu.com/2009/06/23/stories/2009062358320100.htm | title=Centre bans CPI (Maoist) | work=The Hindu | date=23 June 2009 | accessdate=7 September 2013}}</ref> which aims to overthrow the [[government of India]] through [[people's war]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-03-06/india/28147504_1_telugu-deepak-maoists-kishenji | title=Maoists will overthrow govt much before 2050 : Kishenji | work=The Times of India | date=6 March 2010 | accessdate=1 September 2013}}</ref>
== Background == The People's Liberation Guerrilla Army was founded on 2 December 2000<ref>{{cite web | url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-12-17/india/35868361_1_mass-contact-programmes-people-s-liberation-guerrilla-army-plga | title=CPI (Maoist) marks PLGA anniversary with mass contact programmes | work=The Times of India | date=17 December 2012 | accessdate=31 August 2013}}</ref> and known as the People's Guerrilla Army (PGA) by the [[Communist Party of India (Marxist–Leninist) People's War]], also known as the People's War Group.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.satp.org/satporgtp/countries/india/terroristoutfits/peoples_guerrilla_arms_left_wing_extremists.htm | title=People's Guerrilla Army, Left Wing Extremists | publisher=satp.org | accessdate=31 August 2013}}</ref> The PLGA was founded on the first death anniversary of their three Central Committee members, who were killed in an encounter in [[Koyyuru]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/formation-of-plga-a-turning-point-in-the-maoist-movement/article931919.ece | title=Formation of PLGA a turning point in the Maoist movement | work=The Hindu | date=5 December 2010 | accessdate=1 September 2013}}</ref> In 2004, when the People's War Group merged with the [[Maoist Communist Centre of India]] (MCCI) to form the [[Communist Party of India (Maoist)]], their respective armed wings also merged.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.thehindubusinessline.in/2004/10/15/stories/2004101502561900.htm | title=PW, MCCI merge to form CPI (Maoist) | work=Business Line | date=15 October 2004 | accessdate=1 September 2013}}</ref> Therefore, the People's Guerrilla Army (the military wing of the People's War Group) and the People's Liberation Guerrilla Army (the military wing of MCCI) combined to form the People's Liberation Guerrilla Army.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.satp.org/satporgtp/countries/india/terroristoutfits/CPI_M.htm | title=Communist Party of India-Maoist (CPI-Maoist) | publisher=satp.org | accessdate=31 August 2013}}</ref>
== Composition == The PLGA is controlled by the [[Central Military Commission]] of the CPI (Maoist).<ref name="guerrilla warfare">{{cite web | url=http://newindianexpress.com/states/kerala/article192205.ece?service=print | title=Dantawade a pointer to Maoist guerrilla warfare | work=The New Indian Express | date=8 April 2010 | accessdate=1 September 2013}}</ref> The analyses in September 2013, based on [[Maoist]]s' intercepted communication, suggested that the estimated number of PLGA members had decreased (from 10,000 − 12,000)<ref name="T-September">{{citation |title=Top Maoist Leader Ganapathi Admits To Leadership Crisis In Party |url=http://www.tehelka.com/top-maoist-leader-ganapathi-admits-to-leadership-crisis-in-party/ |author=Ushinor Majumdar |publisher=[[Tehelka]] |date=19 September 2013 |accessdate=15 October 2013}}</ref> to 8,000 − 9,000.<ref>{{cite news |title=Reds in retreat |url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/beyond-business/reds-in-retreat-113092700488_1.html |first1=R. |last1=Krishna Das |first2=Sahil |last2=Makkar |first3=Probal |last3=Basak |first4=Dillip |last4=Satapathy |date=27 September 2013 |accessdate=15 October 2013 |newspaper=[[Business Standard]]}}</ref> Recently in March 2014, [[Gautam Navlakha]] has claimed that the PLGA's strength did not decrease but has increased, however, the guerrilla zone has been geographically reduced. He writes that "the number of companies and platoons of PLGA increased from 8 [[Company (military unit)|companies]] and 13 [[Platoon (military unit)|platoons]] in 2008 to 12 companies and more than 25 platoons, plus a supply platoon in 2013."<ref name="Gautam">{{cite web| title=Ambush amplifies a struggle |url=http://sanhati.com/excerpted/9499/ |first=Gautam |last=Navlakha |authorlink=Gautam Navlakha |publisher=Sanhati |date=30 March 2014 |accessdate=16 May 2014}}</ref> All the PLGA members are volunteers and they do not receive any wages.<ref name="Walking with the Comrades">{{cite web | author-link=Arundhati Roy | url=http://www.outlookindia.com/article.aspx?264738-0 | title=Walking with the Comrades | publisher=[[Outlook (magazine)|Outlook]] | date=29 March 2010 | accessdate=15 October 2013 | last=Roy | first=Arundhati | quote=It is an entirely voluntary army. Nobody is paid a salary.}}</ref> The count of ''Jan'' (People's) Militia is around 38,000 which is mostly composed of the tribal people who uses bows and arrows as their weapons and allegedly provide logistical support to the PLGA.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/features/2013/08/2013812124328669128.html | title=Analysis: India's Maoist challenge | first=Kamal | last=Kumar | publisher=[[Al Jazeera]] | date=24 August 2013 | accessdate=31 August 2013}}</ref> During her visitation to the Maoist's guerrilla zones few years back, [[Arundhati Roy]] noted that the PLGA was 45% female,<ref name="Walking with the Comrades" /> but the recent analyses suggests that now the female comrades compose 60% of the PLGA.<ref name="T-September"/> Now, the women commanders heads 20 of the 27 divisions in the [[Red corridor]].<ref name="Gautam"/> It has a military intelligence wing, Central Instruction Team and the Central Action Team.<ref name="guerrilla warfare" /> Maoists manufactures 80% of their arms and looted others from the security forces.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-12-21/delhi/35952735_1_maoists-cadres-dandakaranya-bastar | title=‘LTTE training, police ammo strengthened Reds’ | publisher=Times of India | date=21 December 2012 | accessdate=10 November 2013}}</ref> [[Kishenji]] was one of the commanders-in-chief of the PLGA who oversaw several attacks.<ref>{{Cite journal|last1= Flood|first1=Derek Henry |year=2010 |title=Kishenji:A Profile of the Leader of the Indian Maoist Insurgency |journal= Militant Leadership Monitor|publisher=The Jamestown Foundation |volume=1 |issue=4 |pages=8–11 |url=http://www.jamestown.org/uploads/media/Militant_Leadership_Monitor_-_Volume_I__Issue_4.pdf |accessdate=31 August 2013}}</ref>
== Notable attacks == On 6 April 2010, an attack on [[Central Reserve Police Force]] (CRPF) in their camp in [[Dantewada district]], Chhattisgarh [[April 2010 Maoist attack in Dantewada|killed 76 CRPF personnel]]. This is considered to be the worst attack by the armed wing of the Maoist.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/Chhattisgarh/Maoists-kill-76-securitymen-in-Dantewada/Article1-528116.aspx | title=Maoists kill 76 securitymen in Dantewada | work=Hindustan Times | date=7 April 2010 | accessdate=1 September 2013}}</ref> On 25 May 2013, the PLGA targeted the convoy of [[Indian National Congress|Congress]] leaders in Chhattisgarh; [[2013 Naxal attack in Darbha valley|twenty-seven people died]], including [[Mahendra Karma]], the founder of [[Salwa Judum]]. Karma had been the main target.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ndtv.com/article/india/chhattisgarh-attack-in-4-page-note-maoists-state-why-they-targeted-congress-leaders-372151 | title=Chhattisgarh attack: In 4-page note, Maoists state why they targeted Congress leaders | publisher=NDTV | date=28 May 2013 | accessdate=1 September 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/maoists-responsibility-for-attack-on-congress-leaders-in-chhattisgarh/1/273410.html | title=We punished Karma for launching Salwa Judum: Maoists | work=India Today | date=28 May 2013 | accessdate=1 September 2013}}</ref>
